content:
Diagnosis:
Basal cell carcinoma right cheek

Previous Treatment:
Excision March 2024 - complete excision with clear margins

Current medications:
None cancer-related

Allergies:
None documented

Current situation:
Routine follow-up at 3 months post-excision

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the skin cancer follow-up clinic. The surgical site on the right cheek has healed well with an excellent cosmetic result. There is no evidence of recurrence on careful examination of the scar and surrounding skin. No suspicious lesions noted elsewhere on head and neck examination.

The patient reports no new skin concerns and understands the importance of sun protection and self-monitoring. They are managing well with regular sunscreen use and appropriate protective clothing.

Plan is for final follow-up in 6 months' time with clinical photographs, after which discharge to GP care if remains well. Written information provided regarding signs of recurrence to monitor for.

cancer_timeline.value: Surgical site well healed with excellent cosmetic result, no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Well-healed surgical scar on right cheek, no evidence of recurrence
No suspicious lesions on head and neck examination

status_updates.value: T1 basal cell carcinoma of right cheek treated with surgical excision. Routine follow-up shows good healing with no evidence of recurrence
Final follow-up in 6 months with clinical photographs, then discharge to GP if remains well
